title: Gauging Public Acceptance of Conditionally Automated Cars in the United States
abstract: arXiv:2402.11444v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: In this work we look at an element of smart cities, conditionally automated cars (SAE Level 3), investigating the factors influencing public acceptance in the United States. We apply an adaptation of the UTUAT2 model. Taking an experimental approach study 358 participants in the US were presented with a vignette outlining the L3 technology followed by a series of questions to capture their perceptions of conditionally automated cars. PLS-SEM was used to analyze the collected data. The results reveal that the acceptance of the technology, in order of decreasing importance, was determined by social influence, performance expectancy, hedonic motivation, facilitating conditions, and effort expectancy. translated_title: 在美国评估有条件自动驾驶汽车的公众接受度
translated_abstract: 在这项工作中，我们探讨了智能城市的一个元素，即有条件自动驾驶汽车（SAE Level 3），研究了影响美国公众接受度的因素。我们应用了UTUAT2模型的改编版。通过实验方法，我们研究了358名美国参与者，向他们展示了一个概述L3技术的短篇故事，然后提出一系列问题，以捕捉他们对有条件自动驾驶汽车的感知。采用PLS-SEM对收集到的数据进行了分析。结果表明，技术的接受度，按重要性递减的顺序，受社会影响、性能期望、享受动机、便利条件和努力期望的影响。此外，享受动机、社会影响、便利条件和努力期望都对技术的实用性感知有积极影响；便利条件、享受动机和社会影响...
tldr: 本研究通过调查358名美国参与者，发现社会影响、性能期望、享受动机、便利条件和努力期望是影响有条件自动驾驶汽车接受度的重要因素。
en_tdlr: This study investigates the public acceptance of conditionally automated cars in the United States, revealing that social influence, performance expectancy, hedonic motivation, facilitating conditions, and effort expectancy are important factors influencing acceptance.
